meanings.definition: Giving the impression that something harmful or evil is happening or will happen.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds in the sky looked sinister, like a storm was coming.
meanings.sent2: The old abandoned house had a sinister vibe, making people avoid it.
meanings.sent3: The sinister-looking cat turned out to be a playful troublemaker.
meanings.sent4: His sinister smile revealed his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The sinister figure lurking in the shadows sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: Threatening or portending evil, harm, or trouble; ominous.
meanings.sent1: The sinister warning signs made everyone cautious.
meanings.sent2: The sinister presence in the forest made the hikers uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The sinister storm clouds seemed to be playing a prank on the town.
meanings.sent4: The sinister silence of the night was broken by a distant howl.
meanings.sent5: The sinister aura of the haunted house was palpable as they approached.

meanings.sent1: The sinister character in the movie was the villain everyone loved to hate.
meanings.sent2: The sinister plot of the novel kept readers on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The sinister-looking cake turned out to be a delicious surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sinister deeds of the criminal mastermind shocked the entire city.
meanings.sent5: The sinister nature of the crime scene left the detectives puzzled.
